note.en:
âš™ï¸ **PARECER** and **PARECERSE A** are two different verbs with distinct uses.

ğŸ”¹ **1. PARECER = To seem / To appear (impression, opinion)**

**Usage:** To express an **impression** or **opinion** about something/someone

**Structures:**

**A) PARECER + adjective** (to give an impression)
â¡ï¸ *Esta pelÃ­cula parece interesante.* (This movie seems interesting.)
â¡ï¸ *Juan parece cansado.* (Juan looks tired.)
â¡ï¸ *La comida parece deliciosa.* (The food looks delicious.)

**B) PARECER + noun** (to look like)
â¡ï¸ *Pareces un actor.* (You look like an actor.)
â¡ï¸ *Esto parece una broma.* (This looks like a joke.)

**C) PARECER QUE** (it seems that)
â¡ï¸ *Parece que va a llover.* (It seems like it's going to rain.)
â¡ï¸ *Parece que estÃ¡ enfermo.* (It seems he's sick.)

**D) ME PARECE (QUE)** (I think that, it seems to me that)
â¡ï¸ *Me parece buena idea.* (I think it's a good idea.)
â¡ï¸ *Me parece que tienes razÃ³n.* (It seems to me that you're right.)
â¡ï¸ *Â¿QuÃ© te parece?* (What do you think?)

ğŸ’¡ **Conjugation of PARECER (present):**
- (yo) parezco
- (tÃº) pareces
- (Ã©l/ella/usted) parece
- (nosotros) parecemos
- (vosotros) parecÃ©is
- (ellos/ellas/ustedes) parecen

ğŸ”¹ **2. PARECERSE A = To resemble / To look like (physical/character similarity)**

**Usage:** To express a **physical resemblance** or **character similarity** between two people/things

**Structure:** subject + SE + PARECE A + person/thing

â¡ï¸ *Me parezco a mi padre.* (I look like my father.)
â¡ï¸ *Te pareces a tu hermano.* (You look like your brother.)
â¡ï¸ *Ana se parece a su madre.* (Ana looks like her mother.)
â¡ï¸ *Estos dos coches se parecen mucho.* (These two cars look very similar.)
â¡ï¸ *No me parezco a nadie de mi familia.* (I don't look like anyone in my family.)

ğŸ’¡ **Conjugation of PARECERSE (present):**
- (yo) **me** parezco
- (tÃº) **te** pareces
- (Ã©l/ella/usted) **se** parece
- (nosotros) **nos** parecemos
- (vosotros) **os** parecÃ©is
- (ellos/ellas/ustedes) **se** parecen

âš ï¸ **Watch out:** PARECERSE is a **reflexive verb** (with SE)

ğŸ”¸ **Key difference:**

| PARECER | PARECERSE A |
|---------|-------------|
| To seem, to appear (impression) | To resemble, to look like (similarity) |
| Pareces cansado (You seem tired) | Te pareces a tu padre (You look like your father) |
| Opinion, impression | Physical/character resemblance |
| No SE | With SE (reflexive verb) |
| No A | Always with A |

ğŸ’¬ **Comparative examples:**

â¡ï¸ *Juan **parece** un actor.* (Juan looks like an actor - impression)
â¡ï¸ *Juan **se parece a** Brad Pitt.* (Juan looks like Brad Pitt - physical resemblance)

â¡ï¸ *Esta casa **parece** vieja.* (This house seems old - impression)
â¡ï¸ *Esta casa **se parece a** la mÃ­a.* (This house looks like mine - similarity)

â¡ï¸ *Me **parece** interesante.* (It seems interesting to me - opinion)
â¡ï¸ *Me **parezco a** mi hermana.* (I look like my sister - resemblance)

ğŸ”¹ **Common questions:**

**With PARECER:**
- *Â¿QuÃ© te parece?* â†’ What do you think?
- *Â¿CÃ³mo te parece esta idea?* â†’ How do you find this idea?
- *Â¿Te parece bien?* â†’ Is that okay with you? / Do you agree?

**With PARECERSE A:**
- *Â¿A quiÃ©n te pareces?* â†’ Who do you look like?
- *Â¿Te pareces a tu madre o a tu padre?* â†’ Do you look like your mother or your father?
- *Â¿Se parecen mucho?* â†’ Do they look very alike?

ğŸ”¹ **Common expressions:**

**PARECER:**
- *Al parecer...* â†’ Apparently...
- *Me parece que sÃ­/no.* â†’ I think so/not.
- *Parece mentira.* â†’ It's unbelievable.
- *Parece que fue ayer.* â†’ It seems like it was yesterday.

**PARECERSE A:**
- *Se parecen como dos gotas de agua.* â†’ They're like two peas in a pod.
- *No se parecen en nada.* â†’ They don't look alike at all.

ğŸ’¡ **Summary:**

âœ… **PARECER** â†’ Opinion, impression (to seem, to appear)
  - *Pareces cansado.* (You seem tired)
  - *Me parece buena idea.* (It seems like a good idea to me)

âœ… **PARECERSE A** â†’ Physical/character resemblance (to look like)
  - *Me parezco a mi madre.* (I look like my mother)
  - *Se parecen mucho.* (They look very alike)

âš ï¸ **Common mistakes:**
- âŒ *Me parece a mi padre.* â†’ âœ… *Me parezco a mi padre.*
- âŒ *Te pareces cansado.* â†’ âœ… *Pareces cansado.*
- âŒ *Parece a su hermano.* â†’ âœ… *Se parece a su hermano.*
